file_content.text: Your mission is now complete. There's a shuttle waiting for you in Jiguuna; it will take you to Dromund Kaas.
Once you've arrived on-planet, report to Imperial Intelligence headquarters in the Citadel. I'll debrief you there.
Got it.
I have a few things to take care of, first.
I need a little time.
Do what you have to, but be quick about it.
Don't make me jump through bureaucratic rings.
Great. Paperwork.
If you want another assignment, you will follow orders.
Kaliyo--you will also report to Dromund Kaas. I assume Nem'ro won't be surprised by your sudden disappearance?
He'll be hurt--but no one'll be surprised that I left with the Blade.
And he's certainly not the first employer you've walked out on. In any case, I'll expect to see both of you soon.
Hold on. Who else has Kaliyo betrayed?
"Walked out on"?
This isn't the time or place for that, agent.
Kaliyo Djannis will also report to Dromund Kaas. She'll accompany you on the journey, and I expect to see both of you soon.
We're on our way.
Right.
Good.
Are you sure about this? I'm not convinced she's worth the trouble.
Kaliyo? Really?
Then we can discuss your reservations in person. You have your orders.
It's about time I got out of this swamp.
Finally!
I'll try to find a planet more to your liking next time.
Report to the shuttle as soon as possible. Keeper out.
The deed is done, agent. Nem'ro is already contacting Imperial embassies, looking to establish relations; he'll be eating out of our hands within the month.
In the short term, our chemical and stimulant stockpiles will nearly double. In the long term, we're a step closer to bringing all of Hutta under Imperial control.
I'll make my full report to Darth Jadus shortly. I expect he'll be very pleased with our work.
That's excellent news, sir.
Good to hear.
Your future with Imperial Intelligence looks bright--but we can discuss that face-to-face.
Assuming he's satisfied--does that mean Jadus will leave Imperial Intelligence alone?
Then he's done with us?
I wouldn't assume anything at this juncture. Besides which, that isn't your concern.
You mean my work. I had to cozy up to the Hutts. I'm the one who got results.
"Our" work?
Don't overestimate your importance. This operation required the attention of dozens of men--you didn't do it alone.
Three days ago, Karrels Javis's sons encountered a Sith apprentice in Imperial space. A dispute broke out. One son died, and the other was crippled.
When Karrels hears that a Sith slaughtered his child, his sympathy for the Empire will evaporate. We can no longer use him to get to Nem'ro.
This is an Intelligence project. Sith shouldn't be interfering in our work.
The Sith made a mess.
Can we keep him from finding out?
Only if he knows.
No. Karrels is close to his sons, and the circumstances of the encounter aren't exactly secret. He'll learn, sooner or later.
How could you let this happen?
This is your fault.
The Sith do what they will. We don't control them, and we don't pass judgment on them.
That doesn't mean they're right, or that we obey them without question--but we phrase those questions carefully. We bide our time.
Now, I have a plan to solve our present dilemma, but first we need Karrels out of the way.
You're asking me to kill Karrels.
"Out of the way"?
Are you sure that's necessary?
There's no other choice?
It's unfortunate, but it's the only way to proceed.
Done.
I'm sending you an interference program on a computer spike. Go to Karrels's suites in the palace. Activate the spike to black out his security monitors.
You'll be able to eliminate Karrels and his bodyguards without being seen. When Nem'ro's people investigate, they'll recognize the jamming program as Republic technology.
So we frame the Republic for the murder of Karrels Javis. Why?
To what end?
One step at a time, agent.
Keep going.
I'm not sure I want to do this, Keeper.
I don't know....
You don't have to be sure, so long as the job gets done.
Toth'lazhen--Nem'ro's Twi'lek advisor--already expects Fa'athra to seek revenge for the destruction of his mines. Our job is to show that the Republic helped Fa'athra kill Karrels.
Once Karrels is gone, speak to Toth'lazhen about his suspicions. As Karrels's friend, you'll promise to do whatever it takes to find the assassins.
Is that right? How am I going to find the "real" killer?
The "assassins"?
I'm on it.
Toth'lazhen doesn't trust me, Keeper. That won't change just because Karrels is dead.
No one will believe that.
Maybe not, but we need to put all our pieces into play for the endgame.
For now, get to Karrels's suites and use the computer spike. We'll discuss more once Karrels is eliminated and Toth'lazhen's suspicions have been aroused.
Keeper out.
I understand Nem'ro's shvash gas production is back on schedule, agent. Excellent work. Keep it up, and Darth Jadus may loosen his grip on operations.
However, I'm afraid... unforeseen circumstances have caused a problem.
What kind of problem?
Problem?
You mean the people who broke into my room?
Those dead guys back there?
No. That's a separate matter, and one I advise you to watch closely; but it isn't what concerns me now.
Right. Of course.
On to more immediate concerns: Nem'ro operates a major shvash gas mine on Hutta. The Empire wants access to Nem'ro's refined gas.
Unfortunately, Fa'athra is tapping the same gas pocket as Nem'ro. We need to destroy Fa'athra's operations in the Rust Yards before Nem'ro's grinds to a halt.
So it's a sabotage mission.
I see.
That's correct.
Can't we just buy the gas from Fa'athra, instead?
So why do we need Nem'ro?
Nem'ro's refineries produce shvash usable as a precision explosive. Fa'athra can't refine the gas to the same degree, and he's wasting it by trying.
You don't know how long I've been waiting to blow something up.
I like this.
Then you may enjoy this.
You will travel to Fa'athra's mining facility and place explosives in the drill shaft, destroying the equipment and collapsing part of the gas pocket.
You'll need to strip a uniform and credentials off the facility guards to pass the final security checkpoint. A working disguise is imperative.
What if I can't find a guard in my size?
Might not be easy.
I'm sure you'll make do.
Got it.
Who needs a disguise when I can shoot my way in?
I'd rather fight.
Shoot your way through the Rust Yards, if you like--but the automated security won't let anyone unauthorized into the drill chamber.
Your disguise may not hold up under close inspection, so avoid conversation. The explosives have already been delivered to your room.
Once you're finished, go back to Karrels Javis and make sure he knows what happened. Take the credit, if you like.
It'll be handled. Is there anything else?
Done.
I won't be long.
Fine.
One more thing, agent: Darth Jadus pays increasing attention to your work. He will reward success or failure appropriately, and I will not intervene.
How exactly does a Dark Lord of the Sith reward failure?
"Or failure"?
Best not to dwell on it.
I see.
Good. Then we don't need to discuss it further.
What sort of rewards are we talking about?
Reward?
You're well aware of what I mean, agent.
Report back after you've destroyed the mine and informed Karrels of the results. Keeper out.
The operation is proceeding well, agent. Thanks to your intervention, Karrels Javis will once again have Nem'ro's ear.
I took note of your meeting with Nem'ro's security chief, Kaliyo. You handled yourself well. Still, be on your guard.
We've identified her as a freelance assassin, enforcer and anarchist. She's been attached to a dozen employers in half as many years, using several different aliases.
What's she doing with Nem'ro?
Any more information?
Unknown. In all likelihood, she needed the credits--and if she truly has no loyalty to the Hutt, we may be able to use her in the future.
Understood.
Killing her wouldn't be any trouble. I can lure her somewhere isolated.
Want her dead?
She's a wild card. She may prove a liability, but she could also prove very useful. Watch her.
Imperial Intelligence has determined that Nem'ro's human lieutenant--Karrels Javis--is the weak link in his operation. You're going to twist the man until he serves us.
I don't see it--he didn't seem particularly disloyal.
Why him?
He won't be any trouble to manipulate.
It'll be simple.
You're telling me I have to work with Nem'ro's thug?
Karrels? Ugh.
Karrels has advised the Hutt for many years, and he's sympathetic towards the Empire--he admires our efficiency, and he prefers humans in authority. He'll do for our purposes.
Unfortunately, Karrels is on the verge of disfavor with Nem'ro, while the Twi'lek lieutenant--Toth'lazhen, I believe--is Nem'ro's rising star.
I want you to go to Karrels and offer your services as the Red Blade. Do whatever is required to bring Karrels glory in Nem'ro's eyes.
What does Nem'ro have against Karrels?
Why is he out of favor?
Karrels's work has been suffering due to the interference of the Fa'athra clan. Nem'ro finds that an unacceptable excuse for failure.
What kind of help should I offer? We can't afford to make him suspicious.
How?
You're the Blade. You're a pirate and a trader. You want him as an ally. You're acting as a mercenary. Work it out.
If I must.
Indeed you will.
One other thing, agent: This operation of ours has drawn the attention of a member of the Dark Council--Darth Jadus himself.
The Council's authority is second only to that of the Emperor. It's a rare... honor for an Intelligence operation to be overseen in this way.
I believe I understand, sir. I won't disappoint you.
I see.
With all due respect--what does the Dark Council care about Hutta? This operation isn't exactly a threat to the Sith.
A Darth cares about us?
I don't know why Lord Jadus is interested. Nor is it our concern--the Sith aren't obligated to share their reasons.
We don't need the oversight of Sith to do our job.
It's interference.
Watch what you say. We answer to the Sith, whether you feel we need them or not.
Report back once you've rendered whatever aid Karrels requires. Keeper out.
Well done, agent. The listening device is working perfectly, and Nem'ro can keep no more secrets from us.
Secure transmission established. This is Keeper. We may speak freely, agent; prepare to receive your orders.
I'm ready, sir. What's the assignment?
Understood.
In short? Subversion.
I take it you're my handler?
You're in charge?
Correct. I'm speaking to you from service headquarters on Dromund Kaas. I'll be directing you personally on this mission.
Keeper--should I be thanking you for these lovely accommodations?
Nice place.
Don't get cute, and don't waste my time. You're here to work.
You were chosen for this operation because of your exemplary performance during training. Imperial Intelligence needs agents capable of working independently in the field.
Now you apply your training to the real world. Nem'ro the Hutt and his organization run Jiguuna, and you're in town to convince Nem'ro to supply the Empire.
I understand. How do I proceed?
Got it.
Give me background. What are we working from?
I want all the details.
Jiguuna is an industrial town, and Nem'ro runs most of the industry. The Hutt plies weapons, drugs and raw materials--but not to us.
We believe Nem'ro has been reluctant to lose Republic customers by publicly siding with the Empire. It's time he overcame this reluctance.
Agreed.
By force? Or did you have another method in mind?
How?
It's too early to say for certain.
And I'm your means of making that happen.
So you come to me.
That's correct, agent.
You realize I'm not exactly a diplomat.
That's not my specialty.
If the situation requires a diplomat, you will become a diplomat. But for now, a lighter touch is required.
We need to know what Nem'ro and his advisors are thinking before we can act. I want you to obtain access to the Nem'ro clan's inner circle.
You'll require a cover identity. One of our contacts--an alien named Jheeg--has prepared a background for you and will provide the details.
How do I find him?
So where to?
So who am I going to be?
Cover identity?
You'll be taking the role of a visiting pirate and trader. As I said, our contact will give you the details.
Trust me, Keeper--I don't need any help to get close to a Hutt.
Oh, this is easy.
Don't underestimate the Nem'ro clan. The galaxy has seen more effective gangsters, but rarely more sadistic ones.
Jheeg will be waiting for you at a safe house. Locate him, take what he offers, then report to me.
Are we sure this contact is trustworthy?
Is Jheeg reliable?
Jheeg won't betray us; whether he succeeds at his assigned tasks is another matter. I'd be more concerned with the rest of the populace.
All right.
Should I expect to find trouble?
Any dangers?
Most of Jiguuna is caught up in a turf war. Some of the gangs involved belong to the Hutts; others are independent.
Your combat training should see you through, but expect brutality, and expect to be targeted. Jiguuna isn't friendly to strangers.
Noted. Anything else before I go?
All right.
Thanks.
Neither am I. I can handle myself.
So?
One last thing: Ingratiate yourself with the locals. Get what information you can from them. It may prove useful.
Now find Jheeg and report back to me. Keeper out.
This is a private conversation. Remove yourself.
